segments.text: My gaze keeps returning to that little boy on the stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's so focused on reaching those cookies, it's almost admirable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the stool, it's clearly not stable, its legs are splayed outward.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost feel it teetering beneath him, ready to give way.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Just one wrong move, and he'll be tumbling backward onto that hard floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the floor is already wet from the overflowing sink, making it even more dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of him falling and hitting his head sends shivers down my spine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is so close too; she could easily get caught in the fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This moment feels incredibly tense, like time is slowing down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want someone to step in and stabilize that stool for him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The potential for injury is so high, and no one is noticing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I worry about the sharp edges of the counter and the ceramic plate he's holding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's an accident waiting to happen, and I can't look away.
segments.speaker: PAR
